author: admin
title: To: mohan
text:
Please email me the output after running with "-v"
Thanks.

author: mohan (Guest)
title: tethering on Mac - with password
text:
Made some progress by uninstalling pocket mac.  But now the problem is with the password.... Any ideas??

see the transcript:
********
mohan@fermi bbtether$ sudo python bbtether.py sprint
--------------------------------

author: admin
title: Update
text:
PocketMac won't let me talk to the blackberry at all
Unless you uninstall it it won't be able to connect at this time (might be able to make it coexist at some point, but not so far).

author: mohan (Guest)
title: problem with bbtether on Mac OS 10.5.6
text:
The pyusb-0.41-leopard.pkg installed but did not work.. So I downloaded the source, built and installed.

Now see the text below.  ( I have pocket mac installed! and have used the VZAccess Manager working)

author: admin
title: New version
text:
There was a problem in the last version (0.2l)
Please try the new one (re-download and extract)

author: Author (Guest)
title: Re: Error: couldn?t claim interface
text:
Do you have pocketmac installed by any chance ?
It caused the same problem for another user.
Otherwise please run "kextstat" in a terminal and email me the output
tcolar at colar dot net

author: Guest (Guest)
title: Error: couldn't claim interface
text:
Any ideas?  Installed the new versions downloaded this morning.

--------------------------------
BBTether  0.2l
Thibaut Colar - 2009
More infos: http://wiki.colar.net/bbtether
Use '-h' flag for more informations : 'python bbtether.py -h'.
--------------------------------

the file /etc/ppp/pap-secrets does not exist, will try to create it(required)

author: admin
title: pkg-config
text:
I'm planning to provide binaries for libusb and pyusb, will work on that this weekend (3/22/09)
I had to manually remove the check for pkgconfig if i remember properly.

author: Guest (Guest)
title: In trying to compile libusb, I get an error
text:
hecking for pkg-config... no
checking for LIBUSB_1_0... configure: error: in `/Applications/Utilities/libusb-compat-0.1.0':
configure: error: The pkg-config script could not be found or is too old.  Make sure it
is in your PATH or set the PKG_CONFIG environment variable to the full
path to pkg-config.

Alternatively, you may set the environment variables LIBUSB_1_0_CFLAGS
and LIBUSB_1_0_LIBS to avoid the need to call pkg-config.
See the pkg-config man page for more details.

To get pkg-config, see <http://pkg-config.freedesktop.org/>.
See `config.log' for more details.
